i was also wondering if its possible to defrag an external usb harddrive that has formated to fat32 from ubuntu?
the best way to defrag is to back up, format and restore.
if you haven't got a way to backup your 150GB, you're not following best practice, anyway. Get a backup drive.
especially if you're entrusting your data to a flaky filesystem like fat32
then backup, format *to ext3*, restore, and never worry about defragging again.
feel free to try with Partition Magic. Most likely, it's going to mess things up. Backup, format... I've said it before.
